title: Theophilus Adeleke Akinyele
text:
Chief Theophilus Adeleke Akinyele (29 February 1932 – 26 October 2020) was a Nigerian business consultant and <a href="civil%20servant">civil servant</a>.
Career.
Akinyele was born in <a href="Ibadan">Ibadan</a>. He obtained a BA from the University College Ibadan, (now the <a href="University%20of%20Ibadan">University of Ibadan</a>) in 1959. He also studied at <a href="Oxford%20University">Oxford University</a>, <a href="University%20of%20Connecticut">University of Connecticut</a> and <a href="Harvard%20Business%20School">Harvard Business School</a>.
He served as <a href="Permanent%20Secretary">Permanent Secretary</a> in the <a href="Ministry%20%28government%20department%29">Ministries</a> of <a href="Agriculture">Agriculture</a> and <a href="Finance">Finance</a> of the old <a href="Western%20State%20%28Nigeria%29">Western State</a> of Nigeria, <a href="Registrar%20%28education%29">Registrar</a> and Secretary to the Council of the University of Ife (now <a href="Obafemi%20Awolowo">Obafemi Awolowo</a> University), <a href="Ile-Ife">Ile-Ife</a> Nigeria, Secretary to the <a href="Stratocracy">Military Government</a> and Head of the <a href="Civil%20Service">Civil Service</a> of <a href="Oyo%20State">Oyo State</a> and also as the Director of Budget and Special Adviser on Budget Affairs to President <a href="Shehu%20Shagari">Shehu Shagari</a> from 1979 to 1983. After retiring from public service, Akinyele worked as a consultant.
He held the chieftaincy title of Bobajiro of <a href="Ibadan">Ibadan land</a> and was an Officer of the <a href="Order%20of%20the%20Niger">Order of the Niger</a>.
